snippet: A growing number of self-publishing companies have inspired writers of all ages to bypass the traditional gatekeeping system for determining who could call themselves published authors.
abstract: Hundreds of children, with the help of their parents, are self-publishing books each year; critics believe it is great experience, but worry that self-publishing does not help children understand the concepts of adversity and perseverance; KidPub Press, which began publishing books by children in 2008, says most purchases are made by the families, who buy the books wholesale.
lead_paragraph: A growing number of self-publishing companies have inspired writers of all ages to bypass the traditional gatekeeping system for determining who could call themselves published authors.

headline.main: Young Writers Dazzle Publisher (Mom and Dad)
